questions.question_text: Which of the following protocols is used to transport outgoing mail across networks?

discussion.content: Virtual IP's are pretty standard in load balancing. Also HSRP and VRRP would use VIP's.
I believe it stands for Virtual IP
Virtual IP is the load-balancing where the webpage to get to a site. Usually a TCP or UDP port number is associated with the VIP, such as TCP port 80 for web traffic UDP for watching youtube.
Somebody help me please, what's VIP?

questions.question_text: To increase speed and availability, a high-traffic web application was split into three servers recently and moved behind a load balancer. Which of the following should be configured on the load balancer to allow for a single destination?
Which of the following would a network technician MOST likely connect to power wireless access points in drop ceilings?

comments.content: The the CompTIA N10-007 book does cover inline taps, but very briefly.

discussion.content: you learn new terms on this test ..
mission-critical is key, port mirroring can drop some data in the process as well. Tap in gives you a 100% accurate picture of data flow.
"mission critical" maybe core or middle of core idk

Bypass TAPs (also known as In-Line TAPs) allow you to place an active network tool "Inline" on your critical links. These TAPs are used where monitoring devices need to be placed inline on the network to be effective but putting these devices inline will compromise the integrity of a critical network.
port mirroring is not the correct answer!!!
I picked port mirroring. I never heard of "inline"

questions.question_text: A network technician needs to monitor the traffic going to a mission-critical server in the datacenter. Which of the following is the BEST method to perform this?

discussion.content: When it comes to websites, content filtering is a lot more effective since it is tailor made for web browsing. WAFs are more focused on security and not filtering, protection for HTTP/HTTPS attacks and even SQL injections.

comments.content: the company wants to restrict some web sites, not just web applications

questions.question_text: A network engineer at a large company is restricting Internet browsing on the corporate WAN to only business-related external websites. Which of the following is the BEST solution to achieve this goal while avoiding the need to configure this restriction on each PC?
